Function Documentation

void Message_Init ( MESSAGE_STRUCT *  pstMessage_,
EVENT_STRUCT *  pstEvent_,
USHORT  usSize_ 
)

Initialize the message queue structure, resetting all flags and buffer sizes.

Parameters:
pstMessage_ - the message queue structure
pstEvent_ - the event queue array specified by the owner task
usSize_ - the size of the event queue array
BOOL Message_Read ( MESSAGE_STRUCT *  pstMessage_,
USHORT *  pusEventID_,
USHORT *  pusEventData_ 
)

Read an event from the front of the given event queue

Parameters:
pstMessage_ - the event queue to read from
pusEventID_ - the pointer that the event ID is written out to
pusEventData_ - the pointer that the event data is written out to
Returns:
BOOL - TRUE if an event was read, otherwise FALSE if the buffer is full
BOOL Message_Send ( MESSAGE_STRUCT *  pstMessage_,
USHORT  usEventID_,
USHORT  usEventData_ 
)

Writes an event to a specified message queue

Parameters:
pstMessage_ - the event queue write to
usEventID_ - the pointer that the event ID is written out to
usEventData_ - the pointer that the event data is written out to
Returns:
TRUE if a message was successfully queued, FALSE if the buffer is full.
